text: In 2016, 1.2 million Democrats voted in Michigan's primary. Yesterday, the number grew to 1.6 million -- more than any Michigan presidential primary since 1976. Michiganders know this year's elections up and down the ballot will determine our future. This is our moment. Let's win.
Michigan votes today! Make sure you get out and make your voice heard. Here's your comprehensive guide to what you need to vote!

It's officially been more than a year since the House passed the For the People Act to curb the influence of big money in politics and expand voting rights. Mitch McConnell still won’t bring it to the Senate floor for a vote.

As I've said again and again, the road to the White House runs right through Michigan.  With tomorrow's presidential primary, the eyes of the nation are on Michigan -- make sure you have a plan to vote and make your voice heard.

On this International Women's Day, I want to recognize my partner in the Senate, Debbie Stabenow, who fights tirelessly for Michigan every day. I’m honored to work alongside you and so many other powerful women for the state we love, and your leadership is a constant inspiration.

The fate of affordable health care and coverage for pre-existing conditions will once again be in the hands of the Supreme Court. The consequences for Michiganders if we lose the ACA would be devastating.
One in four Michigan jobs are in agriculture, and our hardworking farmers deserve to be recognized for their crucial contributions to not only feeding our state, but the country as whole.
This is well-earned recognition for the men and women who work tirelessly to keep Michigan safe every single day.
Rural schools have enough to worry about without Betsy DeVos yanking away their funding.

Make no mistake — this year, the ACA is on the ballot. Protections for pre-existing conditions are on the ballot. Access to quality, affordable health care is on the ballot. Winning back the Senate just became more important than ever. Help us fight back: https://bit.ly/2x3rpeJ

Women throughout history have overcome innumerable boundaries, and their impact can't be overstated. Today kicks off Women's History Month -- I encourage you to take some time today to read about the incredible Michigan women whose lives and work have shaped our state and nation.
Here's how Betsy DeVos celebrates National Public School week -- by trying to gut millions in education funding from Michigan schools.
It’s on ALL of us to be active in the fight against climate change. So encouraging to see this momentous pledge to reduce carbon emissions coming from Michigan businesses.
Fat Tuesday means one thing in Michigan...it's Pączki Day!

I'm honored to receive this endorsement from Congressional Black Caucus PAC!“Set politics and party aside: If it's not right for Michigan's small businesses and middle class, it's never been right with me.” - Sen. Gary Peters. ⠀ ⠀ Senator Peters is a Michigan native who is a strong advocate for the people of his state. Throughout his time in the US Senate, he has strived to put their interests above Washington politics. Senator Peters is a Navy Reserve veteran who is committed to ensuring other vets have a fair shot at jobs and adequate care. He believes in strengthening the middle class, making sure all Americans have access to affordable health care, and supporting the interests of small business owners. ⠀ ⠀ The #CBCPAC is proud to endorse Senator Gary Peters for re-election in the U.S. Senate! Visit petersformichigan.com or click the link in our bio to support Senator Gary Peters!

Night school changed my life, so I know firsthand the “traditional” path doesn’t work for everyone -- but we all deserve the opportunity to get the kind of good-paying job that builds Michigan’s economy.
Not everyone's path is the same. But in Michigan, everyone's path should begin with the same opportunity.

I used to be an investment advisor helping families save for retirement, so I know the important role credit unions play to help Michiganders and small businesses achieve their dreams. Proud to continue working with Michigan Credit Union League so we can better serve our communities.
Betsy DeVos is the worst thing to happen to public education. Pass it on.

The Michigan cherry industry has suffered years of unfair competition from foreign countries who flood the market and hurt our producers. I’ll continue leading the charge to hold these bad actors accountable.
Skilled trades programs have literally built Michigan's economy. Making good-paying jobs accessible for all is more than just good policy to me -- it's common sense.
Our veterans have served and sacrificed for our country, and we owe them a debt of gratitude. We must ensure they can easily access the VA resources and benefits they’ve earned.
Happy Valentine's Day to my amazing wife and closest advisor, Colleen. I couldn't do this without you!

Two years since the horrific mass shooting in Parkland. Two years of unprecedented action from young people calling for commonsense actions. Two years of Mitch McConnell blocking any attempt at addressing gun safety. I say this as a gun owner: we have to do better.
Well if Betsy DeVos’ family is this scared of me, I must be doing something right. Join our fight → https://bit.ly/37rxhuO

I’ve spent my life fighting for Michigan because to me, service is about giving back to your community. Whether fighting to protect our Great Lakes or lowering the cost of prescription drugs, I will always stand up for the issues that matter most to us.

Water is at the core of our identity as Michiganders, and because of that, I’m fighting to keep the water in our lakes and our faucets clean. So proud to receive this endorsement from Clean Water Action - Michigan. → https://bit.ly/2UK57IP
Betsy DeVos has fought against public school teachers and students at every turn. Cathy puts it perfectly: Betsy DeVos is unqualified to be Secretary of Education.

Educators are the unsung heroes who make a difference in the lives of so many Michiganders. As the son of a middle school teacher, I'm honored to receive this endorsement from the Michigan Education Association and to continue fighting for our public schools.
I will never stop fighting to lower the cost of prescription drugs for Michigan families.
Who's watching the U of M vs. MSU game today? Our first TV ad of the election just aired! If you missed it, check it out here.

I grew up in a Michigan Education Association home, so I knew about the importance of a strong public school system long before I entered public service. Great to spend the day with the educators who shape our state's students.
When things get difficult, I'm reminded that one of the greatest joys of my life has always been supporting my confident and strong daughters. #GirlDad
I'm so excited to share this: here's a sneak peek of our first ad of the cycle. You'll see it if you're watching the MI vs. MI State game this weekend, but in the meantime, check it out!

‪I took an oath to deliver impartial justice and uphold the U.S. Constitution. The facts clearly show that the President put his personal and political interests ahead of Michigan and our nation, and I will vote to hold him accountable.‬

Excited to support my friend Gretchen Whitmer during her State of the Union response tonight and for the rest of the nation to see what Michigan already knows -- the issues that matter to our state are at the center of this election and the Democratic Party.

For many, the Iowa Caucus kicks off 2020 -- and as the presidential election heats up, I'm resharing my post from the 2019 Detroit debate to remind our future nominee the road to the White House runs through Michigan.
The world is a better place with more Michigan beer. 🍻
The promise of not having six more weeks of winter has me thinking of summers spent riding across Michigan. Take it from me -- there’s no better way to explore our great state!
Being an Eagle Scout taught me the importance of strong leadership and accountability. I promise to always uphold these same values for all Michiganders.
During Black History Month, we honor and celebrate the achievements that African Americans have made in our country and the innovative Michiganders whose accomplishments shaped our state and nation.

The women who defend our nation are some of the bravest patriots I’ve ever met. As a senator and a former Lt. Commander in the Navy Reserve, keeping them and all of our troops safe is my top priority.
No matter what’s happening in Washington, I’m fighting to keep Michigan safe every day.
Small businesses are the backbone of our state, and I'll always stand up for them.
Happy Birthday to Michigan!Happy birthday to our beautiful state!
Michigan cherry farmers have enough to worry about without bad foreign actors flooding the market.
Congrats Gretchen Whitmer! The issues that matter to Michiganders are at the heart of our party, so there’s no one better to give this year’s State of the Union response.
Threatening to cut these crucial services is cruel and unacceptable. I'll fight any and every attempt that tries to take away Social Security and Medicare.
The Great Lakes are part of our DNA. It’s who we are as Michiganders. Share this if you agree that we have a sacred responsibility to protect the Great Lakes for future generations.
No one should face discrimination for who they are or who they love—period. I’m honored to receive the Human Rights Campaign's endorsement.
I’ll always defend a woman's right to make her own personal health care choices. On the anniversary of Roe v. Wade, we have to recommit to stand against efforts that would take us backwards.

Today marks a decade of Citizens United. That’s 10 years of dark money. 10 years of special interests literally buying elections. 10 years of a “for sale” sign on our democracy. Add your name to say you’re in the fight to #EndCitizensUnited: https://petitions.signforgood.com/OverturnCitizensUnited
Dr. King's words and mission are as important today as they were decades ago. We're still fighting to achieve his dream and bridge our divides.
Three years ago. Another reminder why Betsy DeVos should never have been confirmed to be Secretary of Education.

In Michigan and across the country, folks are concerned about how they can afford the health care their families need. No one in America should have to choose between life-saving prescription drugs or paying rent.
Michigan women are a powerful force and incredible leaders.

My dad was a middle school teacher. Through him, I saw firsthand the impact education can have. It shouldn’t matter if you want to go to a four-year university or a trade school, and it shouldn’t matter where you live -- a quality, affordable education should be accessible for everyone.

Pets are part of the family. For many domestic abuse survivors, the difficult choice to leave becomes that much harder if pets can’t come with you. That’s why I championed the PAWS Act to expand pet-friendly shelters and stand up for survivors.
This is outrageous. Michigan cherry growers are some of the hardest workers in the country, and they deserve an equal playing field against cheating foreign actors.
I'm fighting to lower the cost of prescription drugs because no one should have to choose between paying for medicine and putting food on the table.
Tonight's #DemDebate reminds me that as important as the presidency is, we also have to flip the Senate. That can’t happen without protecting my seat in Michigan. Donate now:
Extreme weather can have devastating consequences for Michigan businesses and our economy. That's why we literally cannot afford inaction on climate change.
Students and families are worse off because of Betsy DeVos.
Only in Michigan.

The voices that are often left out of the conversation when it comes to pollution are many times the people who experience it directly. Environmental justice needs to be part of our fight against climate change.
Whether standing up for our Great Lakes or expanding skills training, I'll always put Michigan first.
The Great Lakes are the central part of our economy and way of life, and we have to act now to protect them and the communities that rely on them.

source: Gary Peters,U.S. Forest Service Huron-Manistee NFs
text: Thankful for brave Michiganders like Brian who answered the call to help battle the Australian wildfires. Stay safe -- and thank you for your service.Brian Stearns, a Huron-Manistee National Forests employee is pictured with a kangaroo joey who approached firefighters in the field seeking refuge from the #AustralianWildFires. We are continuing to mobilize U.S. Forest Service fire crews to assist during the #AustralianBushfiresDisaster. Stay safe, Brian. #USwithAUS Read more here: https://www.fs.usda.gov/inside-fs/delivering-mission/excel/forest-service-doi-continue-supporting-australian-firefighting
The consequences of climate change will hit Michigan and the Great Lakes hard. We can't afford to ignore this crisis.
Colleen and I are sad to hear of the passing of Jack Faxon. He was a model public servant whose dedication to his constituents won’t be forgotten.
Couldn’t agree more. Nothing beats Michigan.
Couldn’t agree more. Nothing beats Michigan.
This is huge -- these equipment upgrades and improvements will support Michigan's economy. Proud to have supported Port of Monroe in their grant application.
Standing up for Michigan means standing up for the Great Lakes and the communities around them.

Excited to announce that we had our best fundraising quarter ever! Thank you to everyone who pitched in and supported our campaign to keep delivering results for Michigan. It’s folks like you who will make sure we’re successful in November!

Today, I officially filed to be on the ballot! We couldn't have done this without the hundreds of volunteers who gave their time and effort to collect signatures and canvass across the state. Together, I know we’re going to be successful this November. I’m also proud to say we collected signatures from all 83 counties in Michigan. I’ve always been focused on delivering for the people of this state, no matter where they live. This outpouring of support from all parts of Michigan is both humbling and inspiring. Thank you!
The recent anti-Semitic attacks and attacks on places of worship are horrifying. Whether at home, church, synagogue or mosque, everyone should be able to worship safely and free of fear.

Very sad to hear about the passing of Allee Willis. A Detroit native, she was a gifted songwriter with an incredibly kind spirit. She will be dearly missed, but I know her music will continue to bring joy to so many for years to come.
Merry Christmas from my family to yours! Wishing you and your loved ones a day filled with happiness and good cheer. 🎄
Wishing a very happy Hanukkah to everyone celebrating tonight! May this Festival of Lights bring blessings of health and happiness to you and your loved ones.
John Dingell was a mentor and Debbie Dingell is my friend. To disrespect them is to disrespect the state of Michigan.
Our animal friends can make such a difference in people's lives! Proud of the important work Harv is doing at the Marquette Prosecutor's Office with people facing trying times.

It is unconscionable that after all these years of attacking health coverage for millions of Americans, the Trump administration is STILL in court trying to gut protections for pre-existing conditions and rip coverage away.
I'm all for getting more students interested in careers in the skilled trades. They're solid jobs and the backbone of Michigan's economy.
All eyes are going to be on us in 2020. If we want any chance to take back the Senate, we've got to make sure we win here in Michigan.
Who is ready for some college basketball tonight? Good luck to Michigan Basketball and  Michigan State Basketball on their   games in the Big Ten/ACC Challenge!

1.7 million Michiganders have a pre-existing condition. The White House is suing to gut their health care protections: "If the lawsuit succeeds, protections for people with pre-existing conditions would be wiped from the books."
In the Senate I've focused on keeping our first responders safe and our water clean. Reducing the use of dangerous chemicals like PFAS is an important step in the right direction.
Protecting our Great Lakes needs to be a national priority. I'm proud to have fought for more funding to clean up our waterways and preserve these unique habitats.

Protecting our Great Lakes needs to be a national priority. I'm proud to have fought for more funding to clean up our waterways and preserve these unique habitats. https://mitechnews.com/politics/peters-touts-small-great-lakes-restoration-initiative-funding-bump/
Protecting our Great Lakes needs to be a national priority. I'm proud to have fought for more funding to clean up our waterways and preserve these unique habitats.
The Trump administration is allowing "junk" insurance plans to flood back into the marketplace. We can't let them continue to undermine our health coverage.

Today is an opportunity for us to come together with family and loved ones to take stock of all that we have to be thankful for. I hope that each of you are enjoying time and good food with the special people in your lives. #HappyThanksgiving
We have to take back the Senate in 2020 and put a stop to President Trump and Mitch McConnell's takeover of our judicial system.
As a fifth generation Michigander, I know how important the Great Lakes are to our state. I'm making sure we take care of them for generations to come.
It is an outrage that Americans who risked their lives for this country are not getting the benefits they have earned. I won't stop demanding answers from the White House until this is fixed.
Congrats to Michigan Football on a well deserved win today. I know we’ll be back stronger next year. #GoGreen
Mitch McConnell and Donald Trump continue to reshape our judiciary with far-right judges. Another reason we must take back the Senate in 2020.
I've heard from folks all around the state about the rising cost of prescription drugs. I'm working to bring costs down because no one should worry about being able to afford lifesaving medication.
Your regular reminder that Trump and Republicans are STILL trying to rip away health coverage from millions of Americans.

Today we thank the brave men and women who donned the uniform in service to our nation. Their sacrifices preserve the freedoms that America was built on and continue to make it great to this day.  Every Veterans Day, I think of the men and women I served with in the U.S. Navy Reserve and their dedication to our country. I also think of my father who served in Europe during World War II, and how grateful I am for his bravery and that of his generation. Most of all, I think of the men and women I have met who are veterans of our most recent conflicts, and how they instill in me the confidence that America remains the greatest country in the world.  Let us never fail to honor everyone who has served, for they have truly honored us with their heroism. Thank you and Happy Veterans Day.
Proud to be standing up for Michigan's cherry growers. We need to be cracking down on unfair trade practices and level the playing field for domestic growers.
In Michigan, the Great Lakes are central to our way of life. I'm making sure we preserve them for generations to come.

Michigan, tomorrow is election day! Remember: when you go to the polls, make sure you sign up for the permanent absentee ballot list so voting will be even easier in the future. Make your voice heard and vote!

The Trump administration is working to expand "junk" health insurance. These plans do not have to cover:  ❌ Pre-existing conditions ❌ Prescription drugs  ❌ Maternity benefits I'll keep fighting to protect Michiganders with pre-existing conditions from these junk plans.
This is what happens when you have an administration constantly working to undermine our health coverage. Republicans are literally making it harder for 400,000 children to get health care.

I've heard from Michiganders all around the state who are struggling with the rising cost of prescription drugs. It's unacceptable. I'm working to create a more competitive marketplace that brings costs down.

This is what a failure in leadership looks like: bombing our own bases, abandoning our allies, no cohesive strategy. We have to stop making foreign policy decisions with a single tweet and start listening to the experts. Our servicemembers and allies deserve better.
Democrats have a great opportunity to take back the Senate in 2020, but only if we win here in Michigan. Let's make it happen.
It's no secret this president is trying to line his pockets with taxpayer dollars. I'm going to continue working to make sure he isn’t boosting his bottom line with your tax dollars.

This decision reinforces how badly we need to reform our redistricting process. Democracy works when voters can hold politicians accountable, and that's precisely why politicians shouldn't be the ones picking their voters.

It was so good to talk with my fellow Democrats about the stakes in this upcoming election! 2020 is going to be here before we know it, and it's going to take every single one of us working together to be successful on election day.

This judge was "extremely disturbed" that U.S. Secretary of Education Betsy DeVos would violate a court order so she could help predatory for-profit colleges. But if you know anything about her long career of weakening protections for students, this isn't surprising at all.

I'm honored to receive Sierra Club's endorsement and to stand with such a critical advocate for Michigan and our Great Lakes. I will continue to make sure Michigan is a leader in environmental conservation and addressing the threat of climate change.  Michigan is uniquely positioned to lead the way in driving innovation in green energy technologies like electric vehicles and advancing environmental and conservation policies that create 21st century jobs and preserve our Great Lakes for generations to come.We are happy to announce the Sierra Club's endorsement of U.S. Senator Gary Peters for his 2020 re-election! We are deeply grateful to Senator Gary Peters for his work protecting Michigan’s freshwater, from securing funding to improve water infrastructure in Flint, to fighting to clean up toxic PFAS chemicals in drinking water. He is a true environmental champion who will fight to protect Michigan’s clean air, clean water, our climate, and the Great Lakes.

I've heard from folks all over Michigan who are struggling to keep up with the rising cost of prescription drugs. No one should be worried about going bankrupt just for getting sick. I'm working to bring more competition to the marketplace and drive costs down.

I’m so grateful for the amazing support our campaign continues to receive from Michiganders all around the state. With your help, we had our largest fundraising quarter of the campaign! It's clear Michiganders want effective, bipartisan leaders who get the job done. Thank you!
It's great to see so many small businesses rallying around auto workers' fight for fair wages. These workers have sacrificed so much for Michigan, and now their communities are standing with them.
The Senate is officially up for grabs in 2020. But if we want to take it back, we have to win here in Michigan.

Women's health care decisions should be made between her and her doctor. I will continue fighting to make sure every woman across Michigan has the right to make her own medical decisions. I'm honored to be endorsed by Planned Parenthood Action and #StandWithPP.

Debbie Stabenow is absolutely right. The real-world effects of climate change are already hitting Michigan: increased flooding, damaged crops, spreading of disease. This should be a wakeup call that we need to do more.
It makes absolutely no sense that the wealthiest Americans have lower taxes than middle class families. This is why I opposed the #GOPTaxScam

Proud to be endorsed by Planned Parenthood Action in this campaign. I remain deeply committed to defending women's access to affordable health care and will always stand up against attacks on reproductive rights. #StandWithPP

Republicans have "no viable plans for replacing critical health benefits for millions of Americans," so they are trying to hide the effects of their dangerous lawsuit until after the next election.  We need to be preserving protections for people with pre-existing conditions, not tearing them down.
Because we expanded coverage with the ACA, Michiganders had fewer health complications during surgery, more accurate diagnoses, and easier access to important medication. It has saved lives.
The Great Lakes are Michigan's greatest resource. I'm pushing for more  funding so we can protect them for future generations.

On Manufacturing Day, I thank all the workers who helped make Michigan the hub of U.S. manufacturing and an economic engine for our country. I've always said you can't be a truly great nation if you can't make things, and thankfully in Michigan, we've got the best workers in the world. Today also serves as a time to inspire the next generation to follow that important legacy. There are so many great opportunities for students in Michigan to pursue a career in manufacturing. I'm working to make sure we make them available to as many Michiganders as possible.
There's no question about it: we have to take back the Senate in 2020. That happens by making sure we win right here in Michigan.

Folks in the skilled trades literally built America. Now, they're a big part of the economic growth happening in Detroit. This is exactly why I'm so focused on expanding training programs to get more workers the skills they need.

I've heard countless stories from Michiganders who were finally able to get the health care they needed because of the Affordable Care Act. It has saved lives. Now, we've got to stand up to those trying to tear it down.
It's not just the weather, climate change will affect us in many more ways than we think. We can't afford inaction.

Fighting invasive species is absolutely necessary to protect the Great Lakes and the ecosystems they support. I'll always make sure Michigan has the resources we need to continue to preserve our lakes.

This is very encouraging. There are plenty of great jobs in the skilled trades available right now. I'm especially glad to see programs are helping more women, who are vastly underrepresented in these industries, get the training they need to fill them.
Shanah Tovah to everyone in Michigan and around the world celebrating #RoshHashanah. I hope you all have a sweet and happy new year!
PFAS contamination is a serious health risk. I'm working to fix it. This is about protecting service members, firefighters, and our water for generations to come.
Today marks two years since President Trump and Republicans unveiled their tax giveaway to giant corporations and billionaires that hiked the deficit and left the middle class to foot the bill.
A friendly reminder that Trump and his fellow Republicans are in court trying to gut the ACA and end protections for people with pre-existing conditions. There is no "plan" beyond that.
It seems like every day we find out a new way that climate change is threatening the Great Lakes and the industries they support. That will continue if we don't take action immediately.
Mitch McConnell and Donald Trump are reshaping our judiciary with far-right judges. Yet another reason we need to take back the Senate in 2020.
This shouldn't be hard. Michigan families are suffering right now from PFAS contamination, yet the White House is standing in the way of a bipartisan solution. We need to take action now.
Michiganders’ taxpayer money should not be spent to line the pockets of the president. Glad to join All In with Chris Hayes to discuss how I’m working to end that practice.
Republicans are set on making coverage more expensive and putting Michiganders with preexisting conditions at risk. We can’t allow that to happen. #ProtectOurCare
This is why the fight for the Senate is so important. We can't let Mitch McConnell continue to pack our nation's courts with far-right judges.
The president shouldn't be lining his pockets with taxpayer money. I'm fighting to put a stop to it. This is about accountability and ensuring that your money is being used the right way.

We must not forget that UAW workers sacrificed a great deal when the auto industry was going through tough times, and they played a key role in its comeback. I stand with the workers as they fight for better wages and stronger benefits. And this isn't only about what's happened in the past, it's also about the future. The next generation of auto workers deserve the same fair shot at making the middle class that workers had in the past. That comes with fair wages and benefits.
Mitch McConnell and Senate Republicans need to do their job and let us vote. #EnoughIsEnough

This is what happens when Republicans are in charge of our health care system. Americans are losing their coverage.  "The number of people in the United States without health insurance grew by nearly two million last year."

Today, on the anniversary of one our nation's greatest tragedies, we honor the first responders and mourn for the victims and their loved ones. I'm also thinking of those serving around the world who continue to sacrifice every day for our freedom. We may have been shaken that day, but in the years since, America has shown that when we are united, we can emerge from our darkest moments even stronger. I carry that sentiment with me to this day, and will continue to work towards building a stronger and more united nation.  #NeverForget
This is why the fight for the Senate is so important. Republicans will continue to try to strip insurance and health care protections away from millions of Americans. We can't let them win.
This flooding is just the beginning. If we want to preserve our Great Lakes and the communities that surround them, we have to address climate change.

The shooter in Odessa, who was deemed by a court to be mentally unfit to own a firearm, used a loophole to purchase a gun without a background check. Enough is enough. We must close the loopholes and expand background checks. It will save lives. The vast majority of Americans agree we need to implement commonsense measures to expand background checks. How many more of these stories do we need to hear before Senate Republicans do their job and let us vote?

People in the skilled trades literally build America. That's why I'm so committed to empowering those who pursue careers in the skilled trades because ALL of our kids should have opportunities to succeed.
From the very beginning, this administration has tried to make it harder for Americans to get health coverage. As long as they keep this up, I'll keep fighting to bring down costs and #ProtectOurCare
Team Peters was out in full force this morning! Great to celebrate Labor Day with so many of our amazing volunteers.

Had a great day riding in the Detroit Labor Day Parade, celebrating the important progress the labor community has made on behalf workers everywhere. Unions built Michigan's middle class, and continue to be the reason why we have the best workers in the world!
Great to see the Detroit Zoo is transitioning to 100% Michigan-made renewable energy by 2021. A great example that a more sustainable future is possible when we take action.
What a run! Detroit Youth Concert Choir & Performing Arts Company, we’re so proud of you in Michigan.
I'm proud to have End Citizens United's endorsement in this race. Together, we'll continue to work to get dark money out of our elections. Our democracy is worth fighting for!

The Supreme Court's disastrous decision in Citizens United opened the floodgates for dark money to pour into our elections. In 2014, out-of-state billionaires spent millions in false, negative ads against me in their failed effort to buy Michigan's Senate seat.  That election only reaffirmed how important it is to me to speak out against the endless, undisclosed money that is influencing our elections -- and support efforts to reform our campaign finance system and improve disclosures and transparency. I'm grateful to have End Citizens United's  support in this campaign.
It's incredibly frustrating to see our cherry farmers hurt by unfair trade practices from foreign competitors. I'm working to level the playing field and stand up for Michigan farmers.
Michiganders want workhorses, not show horses in the the Senate. I'm fighting everyday to get things done for Michigan.
I want to wish a very Happy Birthday to Gretchen Whitmer! She's a terrific leader for our state and a dear friend. Have a great day Governor!
I'd say this checks out. When it comes to college football, nobody does it better than the state of Michigan. Sorry Alabama!

For years, Republicans in Washington have tried their hardest to take me out, and they’re going to try again in 2020. It hasn’t worked before, and if we all fight together I know we can win this seat and continue delivering for Michigan.
Here in Michigan, we build things and our workers can outcompete anyone. Always good to see more investment in Michigan manufacturing.

Since the day I got to the Senate, I’ve been a workhorse for Michigan, laser-focused on the issues that we care about here: protecting our health care, expanding job training, and defending the Great Lakes. I’ll never stop fighting for the state I love.  If we’re going to win back the Senate in 2020, we’ve got to win here in Michigan. I’ve never backed down from a tough fight before, and I don’t plan on starting now.
This is what happens when Congressional Republicans give giant corporations and billionaires a huge tax break—while leaving our children and grandchildren to foot the bill.
Climate change will have serious consequences for the Great Lakes & our economy. We need to address climate change as an economic opportunity to protect Michigan's future.

This is a real threat to the future of our Great Lakes. We need to keep working to protect them from invasive species and other dangers to the natural ecosystem.
Republicans are openly plotting to undo health care protections and increase costs for millions of Americans. We can't let them succeed. We have to win the Senate in 2020.
Instead of standing up for students, Secretary DeVos has repeatedly sided with predatory for-profit colleges. Good to see students who were taken advantage of are fighting back.
It's simple. We have to take back the Senate. We have to win in Michigan.
The erosion of reproductive rights is already happening and it could get a lot worse. I'll never stop fighting to make sure these decisions remain between a woman and her doctor.
Glad to see our state taking steps towards a more sustainable future. Protecting our climate must be a priority and it's going to take all of us to make it happen.

Weeks like this remind us just how important it is for Democrats to take back the Senate in 2020. We can't do that without winning here in Michigan.

No matter how many times they try to re-brand it, the GOP health care agenda has been the same for years: less coverage, weaker protections for people with pre-existing conditions, and higher costs. I doubt this will be any different.

Many communities across Michigan are holding primary elections today. Make your voice heard! Find your polling place here: https://mvic.sos.state.mi.us/

I am heartbroken for the victims and affected families in El Paso and Dayton. If two mass shootings in less than 24 hours doesn't convince you that we need to do more as a country to combat gun violence, I don't know what will. This is an epidemic.  And it's not just about the horrific incidents we see in the national news. Families are torn apart by gun violence every single day. It kills more than 36,000 Americans a year.  There are commonsense steps that we could be taking right now to curb gun violence, but Mitch McConnell and Senate Republicans have prevented us from even voting on them. We can't wait any longer. The time for action is NOW. #EnoughIsEnough
The threat of climate change touches so many parts of our lives, from worsening air and water quality, to damaging our crops and infrastructure. These issues affect us all.
Mitch McConnell's decision to play politics with the security our democracy is shameful. Election security shouldn't be a partisan issue.

The idea that the richest Americans need another tax cut - after the GOP just gave one to billionaires and large corporations - is ridiculous. I'll keep fighting to make sure the middle class gets a fair shake.

Great to have the Democratic candidates in Michigan these last few days talking to voters and hearing the issues they care most about. I've said it before, and I'll say it again: The road to the White House runs through MI. Our voters and their concerns MUST be a priority.
Republicans are still trying to gut protections for people with pre-existing conditions. We cannot take our eye off the ball. We have to fight back.

The road to the White House runs through Michigan. I went on @NewDay to discuss what I think our nominee needs to talk about to win here in 2020. Michigan voters and their concerns can't be taken for granted. They want to hear about how we can ensure workers get the skills to find good-paying job, lower prescription drug costs and protect our Great Lakes. These are the issues I hear about every day.
Same story, different day: Betsy DeVos's team got caught giving special treatment to for-profit colleges instead of fighting for the students who they took advantage of.

I’m very excited that the Democratic candidates are coming to Detroit for next week's presidential debates. I wrote an open letter to them about some key issues I believe our nominee must address to win Michigan. You can read it here: https://medium.com/@PetersForMichigan/an-open-letter-to-the-democratic-candidates-96a00a1fb9c1 - We have no more important resource in Michigan than our water. It is central to our way of life. I hope the candidates talk about protecting our Great Lakes and ensuring clean drinking water. - If given a fair shot, Michigan's workers can outcompete anyone. I hope to hear how they will fight for working families, strengthen unions, and expand job training to make sure anyone can get the skills they need to find a good-paying job.  - Michiganders are feeling the squeeze of rising health care costs, especially prescription drug prices. Some even cross the border into Canada to seek out lower prices for life-saving medications. I hope to hear their plans to reverse this trend.  - Our nominee must recognize that MI's diversity is its greatest strength. Communities across our state have felt the sting of discrimination under the current administration. I urge the candidates to fight to reverse their discriminatory policies and stand up for all Michiganders. Michigan can never be taken for granted. Our voters and our issues must be a priority. The road to the White House runs through MI so I hope the candidates will be here early and often.
The rising cost of prescription drugs is having deadly consequences. No one should be forced to ration the medicines they need, like insulin, due to drug company price-gouging.
This perfectly captures what makes our Great Lakes so special: their majesty and central importance to our way of life.
Thanks again to everyone who contributed to our campaign. Together, we're going to make sure Michigan stays blue next year!
"The kind of problems we're seeing now because of  high lake levels and abundant spring rainfall give a hint to what Michigan will endure from full-blown climate change one day."
The GOP health care plan: higher costs and worse coverage. We need to hold them accountable for once again jeopardizing health care protections for millions in Michigan and around the country.
Here in Michigan, we're not taking anything for granted. To win this election, we need everyone pitching in.

This is what happens when you put partisan politics over real people. The GOP is trying to take a sledgehammer to our health care system. Their recklessness will raise costs and gut protections for people with pre-existing conditions.
Prescription drug prices are still rising and this administration has failed to address the issue. We need to do more to bring down costs.

Proud to speak out with my fellow Michigan Democrats against the newest Republican attacks on Michiganders' health care. We won't stay silent as the GOP tries to raise costs and strip coverage from MI families.

The GOP's latest attempt to sabotage our health care system would be disastrous and costly for Michiganders, particularly for those with a pre-existing condition. It’s simply unacceptable and irresponsible.
Ignoring the realities of climate change is irresponsible and a failure in leadership. We can't keep kicking the can down the road.
The U.S. Soccer women's national team are not just world champions, they're also incredible role models for so many across this country and right here in Michigan.

Instead of working to lower health care costs and preserve coverage, Republicans are back in court trying to gut health care for millions of Americans. Their agenda is clear: higher costs and less coverage.

Proud to announce we broke another fundraising record this quarter. I'm so grateful for the amazing support we've received from all over Michigan. The battle for Michigan is incredibly important, and it's going to be tough. But with so many folks joining our campaign, I know we will succeed.  It's clear Michiganders want effective leaders who work hard and get the job done. That's why I'll never stop working to lower health care costs, protect our Great Lakes and make sure every Michigander can get the skills to find a good-paying job. Thank you!
Enjoying a sunny July 4th afternoon in East Grand Rapids. Good to see everyone!
Great to see so many folks at the parade in Kentwood this morning! Happy Fourth of July! 🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸

Lee Iacocca was a visionary and an icon. As he shepherded the auto industry to such great heights, Michigan's greatness rose along with it. He will be dearly missed, but his contributions to our state will never be forgotten.

I couldn't agree more with Debbie Stabenow here. Michigan families want us to bring down health care costs and protect access to coverage. If the GOP keeps trying to strip health care away from Michiganders, I'll keep fighting back.

Republicans are still using the courts to strip health care protections and raise costs for Michigan families. We should be focused on making quality coverage more affordable and accessible, not less.
Everyone should have access to clean, safe drinking water. I'm making sure we find new and better ways to properly clean up PFAS.
The future of the Supreme Court is on the line this election. We can't keep letting the GOP drag our judiciary further to the right. It's time to take back the Senate.
Climate change is already having devastating consequences for farmers. The time for action is now.

We're coming up on an important fundraising deadline.  Michigan will be at the center of the fight for both the US Senate and the Presidency. I need your help to make sure I can continue to fight for Michigan. Join me in this campaign →

🚨🚨🚨 Republicans are STILL finding new ways to try to rip health care away from millions of Americans. This GOP-led lawsuit remains a threat to every Michigander with a pre-existing condition.  It's simple: You cannot support this lawsuit and credibly say you support protections for people with pre-existing conditions. Actions speak louder than words, and this lawsuit exposes the GOP's real record on health care. Don't let them tell you otherwise. I've always fought to protect Michiganders' health care. And as long as Republicans are still trying to rip it away, I'll never stop fighting. That's a promise.

The SCOTUS decision is deeply disappointing, especially here in Michigan where we have some of the worst gerrymandering in the country. Voters should be choosing their representatives, not the other way around. They deserve fair maps.
The auto industry is the backbone of Michigan's economy. That's why it's so important we position ourselves to be at the forefront of the industry now and on into the future.
It's our duty to preserve the Great Lakes for future generations, but we all need to pitch in. Glad to see this effort to get more folks informed and involved.
The GOP tax law is an even bigger corporate giveaway than we first thought. My focus is on building a stronger middle class, not giveaways for those that don't need them.

The President is trying to rewrite his record of undermining health coverage for millions of Americans. We're not falling for it. I'll never stop fighting to protect people with pre-existing conditions.

Republicans just declared Michigan "ground-zero" for Trump's reelection campaign.  We're going to need all hands on deck next year. Join our team here --> https://secure.actblue.com/donate/gary-peters-2
Our farmers are already feeling the effects of climate change, but Republicans in Washington choose to deny and play political games rather than doing something about it.
The battle for the Senate runs through Michigan. No one is going to work harder than I will to make sure we keep this seat blue. Let's make it happen!
I'm disturbed by the recent attacks on reproductive freedoms right here in Michigan. These incredibly hard and personal decisions should be left up to a woman and her doctor. Period.
The opioid crisis is still hurting too many families in Michigan. Curbing unnecessary prescriptions is a step in the right direction.
Great to see two Michigan breweries at the top of this list! You don't have to be an expert to know Michigan makes the best beer in the country. Cheers to Bell's Brewery and Founders Brewing Co.!
The Great Lakes are our responsibility to protect for future generations. We can't keep ignoring the effect climate change is having on them.

No one should should be denied coverage because they have a pre-existing condition and no one should go bankrupt because they get sick. That's why I've stood up to previous attacks on our health care and will do it again if the President rolls out yet another plan that guts coverage protections.
Protecting your personal data from hackers and bad actors is a top priority of mine. That's why I am pushing for more cyber security coordination to keep people safe and our elections secure.

This #Juneteenth is not only a day of remembrance, it must also be a time to recommit ourselves to the important work of building a society that more closely reflects the ideals - equality, freedom, and justice - that this country was founded upon.
The opioid epidemic has hurt far too many families across Michigan. It's a public health crisis. I'm working to crack down on Chinese fentanyl manufacturers and drug traffickers.
All eyes are going to be on Michigan next year. We'll be ready.
Michigan had one of its wettest springs in memory and it's hurting Michigan farms. I'm working hard to make sure we have the backs of our farmers during this tough season.

No matter how many times this administration tries to dress it up, their health care plan is always the same: undo protections for people with pre-existing conditions, allow lifetime limits on coverage, and increase premiums. We can't let that happen.
The values I learned in the Navy Reserve — leadership, problem solving, and commitment — continue to guide my work every day. I'll always stand up for Michigan veterans and their families.
It's absolutely critical that everyone have access to high speed broadband. We have to make sure rural communities aren't left behind.

A woman has a fundamental right to make her own decisions about her own health care. Politicians have no business getting in the way of that. Proud to receive NARAL Pro-Choice America's endorsement in this campaign.
Something is seriously wrong when a vial of insulin costs 10x more here than it does on the other side of the Detroit River.

My father was a World War II vet and a teacher for nearly three decades. He was also my hero. Dad taught me the true meaning of service at an early age, and with three kids of my own, I try to live up to his example every single day. In honor of my Dad and all the fathers out there, Happy Father's Day!

I am proud to stand up for Michigan cherry farmers against unfair foreign dumping:  "We are also buoyed by bipartisan legislation (led by U.S. Senators Gary Peters of Michigan and Richard Burr of North Carolina) to make the process easier to address unfair trade."

Proud to have VoteVets.org supporting our campaign. Our brave men and women in uniform lay their lives on the line to protect our freedoms and defend our way of life. I'll continue to fight for them and all who have served and sacrificed for our nation.
Absolutely ridiculous. If a foreign government tries to meddle in our elections, the FBI needs to know about it. Period. Protecting our democracy should ALWAYS come before partisan politics.
100 years ago, Michigan became one of the first states to ratify the 19th Amendment, granting women the right to vote. We've come a long way, but the fight for women's equality is far from over.

Always proud to see businesses investing right here in Michigan. Michigan is a leader in innovation and entrepreneurship. I'll keep working to make sure we are building a workforce to fill the jobs of the future.

Last year, President Trump and Congressional Republicans supported ending net neutrality protections and give corporations the power to call the shots on internet speed & content. Join me if you agree Mitch McConnell needs to allow a vote to restore these protections for Michigan students and small businesses.
These tariffs on Mexico would hurt Michigan more than just about any other state. They could cost jobs and slash workers’ paychecks. We can’t let them go into effect.

I’m going to continue to fight for Michiganders by bringing down health care costs, supporting our veterans, protecting our Great Lakes and supporting skills trainings. Join me in this effort → https://bit.ly/2HXbBwR

75 years ago today, our brave men and women stared tyranny in the eye, stormed the beaches of Normandy — and won. To me, this day is personal.  My dad served in the Army in World War II and fought Nazi forces to liberate Europe. It was there where he met a beautiful French woman named Madeleine — they married, and moved back home to Michigan.  It was my dad's service that inspired me to volunteer for the Navy Reserve — and why I'll continue to fight for our brave men and women in uniform, and all those who served.

Michigan workers shouldn't foot the bill for Trump's Mexico tariffs. If these go into effect, it could mean job losses and thousands less in annual profit-sharing checks for Michigan autoworkers & families.
When parents send their children off to school, they shouldn't have to worry about their safety. I'm working to improve school bus safety.

I thank Director Mueller for his career in public and military service to our nation. It’s clear the Russians have an extensive operation to influence our elections. We must do everything we can to prevent this interference.
On this Memorial Day, I hope you’ll join me in remembering the men and women who bravely served in uniform and made the ultimate sacrifice to protect our way of life and the safety of our nation.

I was proud to be with the Michigan Democratic Party tonight at our annual Legacy Dinner. I was especially encouraged by how many young leaders were engaged, still fired up and ready to win in 2020! We are Democrats because no matter who you are or where you live, you should be able to get a good paying job, have quality and affordable health care, have a good education and — at the end of the day — retire with dignity. Great to see everyone tonight—I’m excited for what’s ahead!

The Great Lakes are in our DNA as Michiganders—and a pipeline break at Line 5 in the Straits of Mackinac would be catastrophic to our state. I'm going to continue to hold pipeline operators like Enbridge accountable.

Take action! Stand with women! We must all make our voices heard against this outrageous attack on a woman's right to make her own health care decisions in Alabama. Across the country state legislatures, including here in Michigan, are working to roll back the hard-won progress made to protect women and their families.  We have to fight back! Add your name now to stand with women.  https://secure.petersformichigan.com/stand-with-women-2019

Owning a car, buying a home, starting a family—these life-changing decisions shouldn't be dictated by student debt. For too long, our student loan systems have weakened us as a nation. It's past time we made changes to the system so that everyone can reach their potential.
Happy Mother's Day to my mom, Madeleine, my wife, Colleen and my mother-in-law, Kathleen—and all mothers out there. Thank you for all that mothers do each and every day.

"I didn't know" can never be an excuse from university leaders again when it comes to sexual abuse. My bipartisan bill will hold leaders accountable so that a monster like Larry Nassar can never get away with abuse again.

One week after the Trump Administration doubled down on stripping health care from millions, President Trump threatened to veto a bill that would protect those with preexisting conditions as the Trump Administration sabotages our health care system.  Share if you agree: these attacks must end.
Climate change is already having environmental and economic impacts on our state. Taking action can minimize damage to our roads and bridges while saving taxpayer dollars.

Six years ago today, I was traveling on my Senate kickoff tour to hear firsthand from Michiganders about the issues most concerning them. It has truly been an honor to visit with folks in all corners of our great state. #TBT to my stops in Flint with Dan Kildee and Lansing with Gretchen Whitmer!

Mayor Mike Duggan and his Department of Neighborhoods put the call out today for volunteers to help fill and place at least 50,000 sandbags over the next several days to hold back flood waters in residential areas along a series of canals in the Jefferson Chalmers neighborhood near the Detroit River.   To bring relief, the Mayor is asking for volunteers to sign up to help fill and place thousands of bags of sand along key sections of the seawall to effectively raise their height.   “We know that the river usually crests in early June and we already are seeing levels much higher than what is normal for that time,” said Mayor Duggan.  “We expect the levels to continue to rise over the next several weeks and we are asking for volunteers to join with city employees and myself to come to the aid of these residents.” Volunteers and residents who need help can sign up at DetroitMI.gov/flood. Please spread the word!

Michigan cherries are part of what makes our state so unique. But right now, foreign powers are using unfair trade practices to undermine our state's growers and rig the playing field. I'm working to make sure cherry growers can fight back.

While Vice President Pence stopped in Metro Detroit yesterday to fundraise and “claim” support for manufactures, we cannot forget—when it mattered most—he proudly opposed the auto rescue and went on a big media blitz to campaign against it. If he had gotten his way, auto plants, parts suppliers and other business across different fields that were tied to Michigan’s auto industry would’ve gone under and millions of working families and Michiganders would be out of a job.

Climate change poses a serious risk to Michigan’s environment—and economy. On this Earth Day, I’m working on addressing this challenge and highlighting how taking action can save billions in taxpayer dollars.

Making this report public was long overdue. We now know just how actively and intensely Russia interfered in our elections, and it is crucial Director Mueller himself testify to Congress in a public setting on his findings.

In 2014, Republicans spent millions in false, negative ads against me—and they're already gearing up to do so again. It's past time we got dark money out of politics. We need reforms like the DISCLOSE Act to restore faith in our institutions and boost transparency in our campaigns.
Electric vehicles help address climate change while keeping us on the cutting edge of new innovations. Proud to be part of a bipartisan effort to support these vehicles.

Michigan students who have been scammed should know they have support to get through financial hardship. Unacceptable that—under Betsy Devos’ leadership—students are left in the dust in favor of for-profit interests.

‪In 2019, Michigan women still only make 77 cents for every dollar a man makes. That needs to change. On this Equal Pay Day, I reiterate my call for the Senate to pass the Paycheck Fairness Act so we can help right this wrong.‬

President Trump just finished his rally, where he made it clear Michigan is a top target in 2020. He and his allies will spend millions to try to turn it red. We're not going to let him. There couldn't be more at stake—join me in fighting back! https://secure.petersformichigan.com/Join-Team-Peters

President Trump is coming to Michigan for a rally today—while his Administration is pushing (again) to end protections for Michiganders with preexisting conditions. We can't let this happen. Join my team → https://secure.petersformichigan.com/Join-Team-Peters

Just when you thought Betsy DeVos’ tenure as Secretary of Education couldn’t get worse, she proposes ELIMINATING funding for the Special Olympics. Add this to the long list of things in the President’s budget I’ll work to prevent.

The Trump Administration is openly pushing for Michigan families to lose their health care. It means no protections for those with pre-existing conditions, seniors face up to five times the cost and so much more.  There couldn't be more at stake—like and share if you'll stand with me in fighting back.
A conclusion with key findings is not enough. The American people deserve full transparency—we need the full report.

Today’s the 9th anniversary of the Affordable Care Act being signed into law. And Republicans are still pushing to go back to the days when insurance companies could charge more to seniors and deny care to those with pre-existing conditions. We must protect the ACA.
March Madness Saturday in Michigan! Here’s to hoping Michigan State Basketball and Michigan Basketball can push on to the Sweet 16!
The Mueller report needs to be made fully public, as soon as possible.

So what is the President's actual position? Just last week President Trump said the Mueller report should NOT be made public. Michiganders deserve the full story—share if you stand with me in demanding the Mueller Report be fully released to the public.

I'll always cheer for Michigan Basketball when they're not playing Michigan State Basketball —but I think that's going to happen for a FOURTH time this year in the Final Four! Which upsets do you have, and who do you have winning it all?
Michigan State Basketball: Big Ten regular season AND tournament champs! Congratulations—March Madness begins! I’ll be posting my bracket this week with my pick to win it all.
‪Happy birthday mom! Loved spending the afternoon with my two favorite Madeleines ❤️‬
The House UNANIMOUSLY voted to support making the Mueller report public. This isn’t a partisan game—like and share if you agree the Senate needs to act immediately!

The Trump Administration calls this a "Budget for a Better America." So how does this Administration think slashing funding for Great Lakes clean-up makes our country better? There's no way I'm letting these cuts happen.

It’s time to stand up for our Democracy. If you care about: ✅ Protecting the right to vote; ✅ Getting dark money out of our politics; and ✅ Improving transparency by requiring ALL candidates for president to disclose their tax returns Then we need to pass the Voting Rights Advancement Act. Share if you agree: we need Senate Republicans to stop their obstruction and put this bill up for a vote!

1. Betsy DeVos reinstates an accreditor that approved for-profit schools like ITT Tech that scammed Michigan students. 2. The department's independent watchdog (inspector general) said she would look into it. 3. DeVos' team warns the IG to drop the investigation 4. The IG refuses — and DeVos tries to replace her. I've worked to close the skills gap in our state because it means thousands of good-paying jobs for workers and their families. This state-of-the-art training & apprenticeship facility in Detroit will do just that for people all over Michigan.
Michiganders need immediate action to address PFAS contamination of our water. The EPA’s “plan” on PFAS doesn’t do that. That’s why I’m joining with my colleagues to help force action. Read more —>

We need to protect our state’s Great Lakes against threats—especially climate change. Proud of my perfect score from the League of Conservation Voters. I’ll keep fighting so that Michiganders have clean air to breathe, clean water to drink & that funding to clean-up our Great Lakes is protected.

The allegations from Michael Cohen were disturbing. I thank Chairman Cummings for holding this hearing which should have happened months ago. It did happen today because elections matter. Today reinforced the fact that the Mueller investigation must be protected and completed. And when it is, it must be released in full.

Here in Michigan we make things - it's in our DNA. That's why I work each and every day to support Michigan manufacturing, which is leading the way in cutting-edge technology. This announcement is great news: in addition to 6,500 new jobs, Michigan workers will help build hybrid and electric vehicles. Congratulations to everyone who helped make this happen!

Honored to have League of Conservation Voters’ support. Michigan is home to an abundance of natural resources—from our Great Lakes to our forests. I'm committed to protecting them for future generations.LCVAF is thrilled to endorse Gary Peters in his re-election campaign to represent Michigan in the Senate! From securing funding to upgrade water infrastructure in Flint to fighting for strong standards to regulate toxic PFAS chemicals, he has been a champion for clean, safe drinking water for every community.

Years ago, we stood together against Big Oil storing pet coke piles on the Detroit River—and won. Now, they're trying to store it again.  We need all hands on deck to send a message: NO to pet coke piles in Detroit. Sign your name —> https://bit.ly/2tCDfrf

Betsy DeVos tried to remove the independent watchdog looking into her decision to empower an organization that oversaw for-profit colleges & defrauded Michiganders.  What's she hiding? My colleagues & I are looking into it and demanding answers.

We know PFAS contamination has serious health & environmental effects. The impact has been felt in communities from Oscoda to Belmont. So why isn't the Trump Administration taking immediate action to protect Michigan families? Add your name to my petition calling on President Trump's EPA to protect Michiganders from PFAS exposure → https://bit.ly/2TWyvs2 I'm going to continue pressing for action on the need for clean-up & stronger drinking water protections.

Pet coke is the dirtiest of the dirty fuels. It blew into peoples’ homes and formed large moving dust clouds when it was stored in the open along the Detroit River. Share if you agree: NO to pet coke piles in Detroit.

Colleen & I were honored to have known Chairman Dingell. It’s thanks to him we have key environmental protections, millions of families and seniors have access to health care & more. We couldn’t be prouder to call him a fellow Michigander—and a dear friend. We miss him already.

Proud to join with thousands of Democrats in Detroit today for the Michigan Democratic Party convention! It was exciting to see Democrats from all walks of life united around ideals we all believe in.  Let’s be clear: out of state billionaires are going to do everything they can to spread false attacks and try to buy our elections. But if today’s any indication, Democrats are motivated, energized and ready to win in 2020 just as they did in 2018. Congrats to our new chair Lavora Barnes: excited to work with you!

Very sad to hear about the passing of Allee Willis. A Detroit native, she was a gifted songwriter with an incredibly kind spirit. She will be dearly missed, but I know her music will continue to bring joy to so many for years to come.
John Dingell was a mentor and Debbie Dingell is my friend. To disrespect them is to disrespect the state of Michigan.
Our animal friends can make such a difference in people's lives! Proud of the important work Harv is doing at the Marquette Prosecutor's Office with people facing trying times.

It is unconscionable that after all these years of attacking health coverage for millions of Americans, the Trump administration is STILL in court trying to gut protections for pre-existing conditions and rip coverage away.
The Trump administration is allowing "junk" insurance plans to flood back into the marketplace. We can't let them continue to undermine our health coverage.
We have to take back the Senate in 2020 and put a stop to President Trump and Mitch McConnell's takeover of our judicial system.
It is an outrage that Americans who risked their lives for this country are not getting the benefits they have earned. I won't stop demanding answers from the White House until this is fixed.
Congrats to Michigan Football on a well deserved win today. I know we’ll be back stronger next year. #GoGreen
Mitch McConnell and Donald Trump continue to reshape our judiciary with far-right judges. Another reason we must take back the Senate in 2020.

Today we thank the brave men and women who donned the uniform in service to our nation. Their sacrifices preserve the freedoms that America was built on and continue to make it great to this day.  Every Veterans Day, I think of the men and women I served with in the U.S. Navy Reserve and their dedication to our country. I also think of my father who served in Europe during World War II, and how grateful I am for his bravery and that of his generation. Most of all, I think of the men and women I have met who are veterans of our most recent conflicts, and how they instill in me the confidence that America remains the greatest country in the world.  Let us never fail to honor everyone who has served, for they have truly honored us with their heroism. Thank you and Happy Veterans Day.
In Michigan, the Great Lakes are central to our way of life. I'm making sure we preserve them for generations to come.

I've heard from Michiganders all around the state who are struggling with the rising cost of prescription drugs. It's unacceptable. I'm working to create a more competitive marketplace that brings costs down.

This is what a failure in leadership looks like: bombing our own bases, abandoning our allies, no cohesive strategy. We have to stop making foreign policy decisions with a single tweet and start listening to the experts. Our servicemembers and allies deserve better.
It's no secret this president is trying to line his pockets with taxpayer dollars. I'm going to continue working to make sure he isn’t boosting his bottom line with your tax dollars.

I'm honored to receive Sierra Club's endorsement and to stand with such a critical advocate for Michigan and our Great Lakes. I will continue to make sure Michigan is a leader in environmental conservation and addressing the threat of climate change.  Michigan is uniquely positioned to lead the way in driving innovation in green energy technologies like electric vehicles and advancing environmental and conservation policies that create 21st century jobs and preserve our Great Lakes for generations to come.We are happy to announce the Sierra Club's endorsement of U.S. Senator Gary Peters for his 2020 re-election! We are deeply grateful to Senator Gary Peters for his work protecting Michigan’s freshwater, from securing funding to improve water infrastructure in Flint, to fighting to clean up toxic PFAS chemicals in drinking water. He is a true environmental champion who will fight to protect Michigan’s clean air, clean water, our climate, and the Great Lakes.

I’m so grateful for the amazing support our campaign continues to receive from Michiganders all around the state. With your help, we had our largest fundraising quarter of the campaign! It's clear Michiganders want effective, bipartisan leaders who get the job done. Thank you!
The Senate is officially up for grabs in 2020. But if we want to take it back, we have to win here in Michigan.
The Great Lakes are Michigan's greatest resource. I'm pushing for more  funding so we can protect them for future generations.

On Manufacturing Day, I thank all the workers who helped make Michigan the hub of U.S. manufacturing and an economic engine for our country. I've always said you can't be a truly great nation if you can't make things, and thankfully in Michigan, we've got the best workers in the world. Today also serves as a time to inspire the next generation to follow that important legacy. There are so many great opportunities for students in Michigan to pursue a career in manufacturing. I'm working to make sure we make them available to as many Michiganders as possible.

Fighting invasive species is absolutely necessary to protect the Great Lakes and the ecosystems they support. I'll always make sure Michigan has the resources we need to continue to preserve our lakes.

This is very encouraging. There are plenty of great jobs in the skilled trades available right now. I'm especially glad to see programs are helping more women, who are vastly underrepresented in these industries, get the training they need to fill them.
PFAS contamination is a serious health risk. I'm working to fix it. This is about protecting service members, firefighters, and our water for generations to come.
It seems like every day we find out a new way that climate change is threatening the Great Lakes and the industries they support. That will continue if we don't take action immediately.
Mitch McConnell and Donald Trump are reshaping our judiciary with far-right judges. Yet another reason we need to take back the Senate in 2020.
This shouldn't be hard. Michigan families are suffering right now from PFAS contamination, yet the White House is standing in the way of a bipartisan solution. We need to take action now.

We must not forget that UAW workers sacrificed a great deal when the auto industry was going through tough times, and they played a key role in its comeback. I stand with the workers as they fight for better wages and stronger benefits. And this isn't only about what's happened in the past, it's also about the future. The next generation of auto workers deserve the same fair shot at making the middle class that workers had in the past. That comes with fair wages and benefits.
Mitch McConnell and Senate Republicans need to do their job and let us vote. #EnoughIsEnough

I am heartbroken for the victims and affected families in El Paso and Dayton. If two mass shootings in less than 24 hours doesn't convince you that we need to do more as a country to combat gun violence, I don't know what will. This is an epidemic.  And it's not just about the horrific incidents we see in the national news. Families are torn apart by gun violence every single day. It kills more than 36,000 Americans a year.  There are commonsense steps that we could be taking right now to curb gun violence, but Mitch McConnell and Senate Republicans have prevented us from even voting on them. We can't wait any longer. The time for action is NOW. #EnoughIsEnough

I’m very excited that the Democratic candidates are coming to Detroit for next week's presidential debates. I wrote an open letter to them about some key issues I believe our nominee must address to win Michigan. You can read it here: https://medium.com/@PetersForMichigan/an-open-letter-to-the-democratic-candidates-96a00a1fb9c1 - We have no more important resource in Michigan than our water. It is central to our way of life. I hope the candidates talk about protecting our Great Lakes and ensuring clean drinking water. - If given a fair shot, Michigan's workers can outcompete anyone. I hope to hear how they will fight for working families, strengthen unions, and expand job training to make sure anyone can get the skills they need to find a good-paying job.  - Michiganders are feeling the squeeze of rising health care costs, especially prescription drug prices. Some even cross the border into Canada to seek out lower prices for life-saving medications. I hope to hear their plans to reverse this trend.  - Our nominee must recognize that MI's diversity is its greatest strength. Communities across our state have felt the sting of discrimination under the current administration. I urge the candidates to fight to reverse their discriminatory policies and stand up for all Michiganders. Michigan can never be taken for granted. Our voters and our issues must be a priority. The road to the White House runs through MI so I hope the candidates will be here early and often.
This perfectly captures what makes our Great Lakes so special: their majesty and central importance to our way of life.
Here in Michigan, we're not taking anything for granted. To win this election, we need everyone pitching in.

This is what happens when you put partisan politics over real people. The GOP is trying to take a sledgehammer to our health care system. Their recklessness will raise costs and gut protections for people with pre-existing conditions.

Proud to speak out with my fellow Michigan Democrats against the newest Republican attacks on Michiganders' health care. We won't stay silent as the GOP tries to raise costs and strip coverage from MI families.

Proud to join with thousands of Democrats in Detroit today for the Michigan Democratic Party convention! It was exciting to see Democrats from all walks of life united around ideals we all believe in.  Let’s be clear: out of state billionaires are going to do everything they can to spread false attacks and try to buy our elections. But if today’s any indication, Democrats are motivated, energized and ready to win in 2020 just as they did in 2018. Congrats to our new chair Lavora Barnes: excited to work with you!
